task_summary: Robot arm picks up a white cube from a shelf using visual and grasping actions.

task_long_description.overview: The robot uses its arm to approach, localize, and pick up a small white cube positioned on the upper-right shelf of a dark-colored cabinet within an indoor environment. The process includes visual search/verification, precise end-effector positioning above the cube, gripper opening, pose computation, and executing a grasp. The robot uses automatic verification to ensure object acquisition. Safety and efficiency are considered, with repeated perception attempts allowed in case of occlusion or miss.
preconditions: Cube is present and not occluded on the shelf
Robot is operational and in a reachable starting pose
stepwise_plan: Check cube visibility or scan to locate
Move the end-effector above the cube
Verify cube is stably in gripper
success_criteria: Cube is securely held by gripper
No collision or dropped object during process
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect: retry scan up to 3 times
Failure to grasp: task aborts, no further recovery
Object not in gripper: task fails at verification step
task_long_description.termination: Sequence ends when cube is in gripper or failure recovery is exhausted

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the cube is currently visible in the robot's sensors.
Performs a raster scan to search for the cube up to 3 times.
Detects and localizes the cube for precise manipulation.
Positions the gripper above the cube to prepare for approach.
Approaches and precisely aligns the end-effector with the cube.
Opens the gripper to a width ready for top grasping of the cube.
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the cube and saves to blackboard.
Executes grasping motion at the previously computed pose.
Verifies the cube is now held in the gripper.

failure_modes: Cube not visible: repeated scan attempts, may abort if failed
Cube not detected due to occlusion
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for cube visibility up to 3 attempts
assumptions: The white block on the upper shelf is interpreted as the 'cube' per instruction and visual evidence.
No explicit gripper force or tolerance was given in instruction; BT uses defaults and mid-bin values.
Frames indicate a direct and successful approach and grasp, without interaction failures.

expected_success_criteria: The robot's gripper securely holds the cube at the end of the sequence.
